definitions.text: something superior in quality or condition or effect
someone who bets
a superior person having claim to precedence
examples: the common man has been kept in his place by his betters

definitions.text: the superior one of two alternatives
examples: chose the better of the two

definitions.text: surpass in excellence
to make better
examples: The editor improved the manuscript with his changes

definitions.text: get better
(comparative of `good') superior to another (of the same class or set or kind) in excellence or quality or desirability or suitability; more highly skilled than another
examples: You're a better man than I am, Gunga Din
a suit with a better fit
she's better in math than in history

definitions.text: (comparative of `good') changed for the better in health or fitness
(comparative and superlative of `well') wiser or more advantageous and hence advisable
examples: it would be better to speak to him
the White House thought it best not to respond

definitions.text: more than half
examples: argued for the better part of an hour

definitions.text: having desirable or positive qualities especially those suitable for a thing specified
examples: when she was good she was very very good
a good knife is one good for cutting
this stump will make a good picnic table
a good dress for the office

definitions.text: having the normally expected amount
morally admirable
deserving of esteem and respect
promoting or enhancing well-being
examples: an arms limitation agreement beneficial to all countries
the beneficial effects of a temperate climate
the experience was good for her

definitions.text: agreeable or pleasing
examples: we all had a good time

definitions.text: of moral excellence
having or showing knowledge and skill and aptitude
examples: a lesser-known but no less skillful composer
the effect was achieved by skillful retouching

definitions.text: thorough
examples: gave the house a good cleaning

definitions.text: with or in a close or intimate relationship
examples: my sisters and brothers are near and dear

definitions.text: financially sound
most suitable or right for a particular purpose
examples: a good time to plant tomatoes
the time is ripe for great sociological changes

definitions.text: resulting favorably
examples: it's a good thing that I wasn't there
it is good that you stayed
it is well that no one saw you

definitions.text: exerting force or influence
examples: a warranty good for two years
the law is already in effect (or in force)

definitions.text: capable of pleasing
appealing to the mind
in excellent physical condition
examples: I still have one good leg
a sound mind in a sound body

definitions.text: tending to promote physical well-being; beneficial to health
examples: beneficial effects of a balanced diet
the salutary influence of pure air

definitions.text: not forged
not left to spoil
generally admired
in good health especially after having suffered illness or injury
examples: I think I'm well; at least I feel well

definitions.text: resulting favorably
examples: it's a good thing that I wasn't there
it is good that you stayed
it is well that no one saw you

definitions.text: wise or advantageous and hence advisable
examples: it would be well to start early

definitions.text: comparative of `well'; in a better or more excellent manner or more advantageously or attractively or to a greater degree etc.
from a position of superiority or authority
(often used as a combining form) in a good or proper or satisfactory manner or to a high standard (`good' is a nonstandard dialectal variant for `well')
examples: the baby can walk pretty good

definitions.text: thoroughly or completely; fully; often used as a combining form; ; ; ; ; ,
examples: in order to avoid food poisoning be sure the meat is well cooked

definitions.text: indicating high probability; in all likelihood
examples: a mistake that could easily have ended in disaster
you may well need your umbrella
he could equally well be trying to deceive us

definitions.text: (used for emphasis or as an intensifier) entirely or fully
examples: was well aware of the difficulties ahead
suspected only too well what might be going on

definitions.text: to a suitable or appropriate extent or degree
examples: the fetus has well developed organs
his father was well pleased with his grades

definitions.text: favorably; with approval
examples: their neighbors spoke well of them
he thought well of the book

definitions.text: to a great extent or degree
examples: I'm afraid the film was well over budget
painting the room white made it seem considerably (or substantially) larger
the house has fallen considerably in value

definitions.text: with great or especially intimate knowledge
with prudence or propriety
examples: You would do well to say nothing more

definitions.text: with skill or in a pleasing manner
in a manner affording benefit or advantage
examples: The children were settled advantageously in Seattle

definitions.text: in financial comfort
examples: she has been able to live comfortably since her husband died

definitions.text: without unusual distress or resentment; with good humor
